front.title: Using Device-provided Location Measurements in HELD

abstract.t: A method is described by which a Device is able to provide measurement data to a LIS within a HELD request. Measurement information are observations about the position of a Device, which could be data about network attachment or about the physical environment around the LIS. When a LIS generates location information for a device, information from the device can improve the accuracy of the location estimate. A basic set of measurements are defined, including common modes of network attachment as well as assisted Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) parameters.
